item.title: The Traders Hotel in Yangon has been rebranded as the Sule Shangri-La, Yangon
item.description:
After a comprehensive two-and-a-half-year renovation, Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts has rebranded the Traders Hotel, Yangon in Myanmar to the Sule Shangri-La, Yangon. Situated on Sule Pagoda Road near its 2,000-year-old namesake, the 484-room hotel has been a prominent landmark in the city’s central business district since 1996, remaining a popular hub for business gatherings. Source: Shangri-la. Service staff in the Peacock Lounge. While the building’s exterior is modern, the lobby of the Sule Shangri-La, Yangon evokes a sense of a bygone colonial era with its white columns and grand staircase leading to an open balcony...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-traders-hotel-in-yangon-has-been-rebranded-as-the-sule-shangri-la-yangon/
